column1: “My courtyard only gets morning sunlight. Which flowering plants will still bloom well here?”
“Which native shrubs won’t attract snakes or rodents near my home?”
“What plants can I grow on my rooftop that can handle the heat?”
“My house is near a dusty road — what plants can help reduce dust entering our home?”
“Our backyard soil is very hard and cracked. What plants can still grow in such soil?”
“Which plants give good fragrance in the evening?”
“What plants can I grow around my water tank that won’t damage the structure?”
“We want a kitchen herb garden — what medicinal plants grow fast and don’t need much care?”
“My lane has almost no shade. Which small trees grow quickly and don’t require frequent watering?”
“What plants can be placed around the hand pump for better drainage?”
“Our space is tiny. What potted native plants would look beautiful and survive heat waves?”
“Which plants can handle air pollution from nearby trucks and buses?”
“Are there any native insect-repellent plants safe for homes with children?”
“We want plants that keep mosquitoes away — what grows well in this climate?”
“Our well water is slightly salty — which plants can tolerate that when used for irrigation?”
“Which plants help restore nitrogen in the soil after paddy cultivation?”
“What native species can grow on field bunds without disturbing crops?”
“Which plants prevent soil loss from the edges of irrigation canals?”
“We want shade trees that won’t harm nearby crops — what are good options?”
“Which shrubs attract pollinators to help increase yields in nearby farms?”
“What plants survive well in fields that flood every monsoon?”
“Which native plants have good fodder value for cattle?”
“Are there native plants that naturally control pests in rice fields?”
“Which species grow in sandy riverbank soil and stabilize it?”
“Our fields are getting saline — which halophyte plants are safe to introduce?”
“We want species used traditionally by the Tharu community — what grows easily?”
“Which medicinal plants used by Santhal healers can we cultivate locally?”
“Are there plants suitable for rice-fish integrated systems?”
“What local plants can regenerate degraded grazing lands?”
“Which species have roots that improve soil structure over time?”
“Which native plants can replace expensive exotic hedge species?”
“What fast-growing species are best for creating privacy screens around homes?”
“Which plants should we avoid because they become invasive?”
“For a government office, which plants look formal yet are low maintenance?”
“Which plants tolerate reflected heat from concrete walls and pavements?”
“What species can we plant near septic tanks without damaging pipes?”
“Which shrubs flower year-round in the Indo-Gangetic climate?”
“Which plants handle both winter fog and summer heat?”
“We need plants that stay green even during water shortages — what are good options?”
“Which groundcovers help suppress weeds without spreading too aggressively?”
“What native species can replace lawn grass for a low-water landscape?”
“Which plants can safely be planted under power lines?”
“Which species tolerate poor, rocky roadside soil?”
“What plants can soften building edges and provide a welcoming appearance?”
“Which ornamental plants are commonly used in local public parks?”
“We want culturally significant plants around our temple entrance — what should we choose?”
“For school gardens, which plants are safe for children to interact with?”
“Which plants flower during major festivals like Holi, Diwali, or Eid?”
“Our community hall needs shade trees — which ones don’t drop large branches?”
“Which plants support local bird species for educational purposes?”
“What species can be used for creating a butterfly garden in the village?”
“We want native plants for our village’s biodiversity corner — what should we include?”
“Which plants bloom in winter and make public spaces look colorful?”
“Our playground is very dry and dusty — what plants can help hold the soil?”
“Which plants have strong ties to local folklore we can highlight on signage?”
“What trees are commonly planted on village roadsides for shade?”
“Our Panchayat wants a medicinal plant garden — what native species should we feature?”
“We want plants that are sacred to both Hindus and Buddhists — any suggestions?”
“Which species can be planted near water taps to reduce mud and increase drainage?”
“What plants can be used for boundary marking without creating safety hazards?”
“Which native plants best represent the ecological heritage of northern India for diplomatic events?”
“What species require the least maintenance due to limited staffing?”
“We need plants that stay visually appealing year-round for official photo opportunities.”
“Which native aquatic plants are suitable for embassy water features?”
“Are there culturally safe plants to use near prayer or quiet reflection areas?”
“Which local plants are viewed positively across Hindu, Muslim, Sikh, and Buddhist communities?”
“Which plants can create shaded walkways for staff during hot months?”
“What species minimize allergy issues for embassy staff?”
“We need plants that deter insects around outdoor seating areas — what works locally?”
“Which species can serve as noise buffers along the embassy perimeter?”
“What plants should be avoided due to cultural sensitivities?”
“Which native plants help reduce the embassy’s water consumption?”
“What plants are recommended for areas with security lighting that stays on at night?”
“Which species can survive both monsoon flooding and summer drought inside the compound?”
“We want plants suitable for educational signage for visitors — which have strong cultural stories?”
“Our land floods knee-deep every monsoon — what long-term plants can survive this?”
“Which plants recover quickly after waterlogging?”
“Our soil is becoming alkaline — what native plants tolerate this shift?”
“Summers are getting hotter each year — which drought-tolerant trees grow well?”
“What plants withstand repeated cycles of wet monsoon and dry winter?”
“Which salt-tolerant plants also grow well in full sun?”
“Our village well is drying — we need water-wise plants for communal areas.”
“Which local species tolerate fog and cold winters near the Himalayan foothills?”
“What native plants tolerate gravelly riverbank soils?”
“Which shrubs can handle strong winds during pre-monsoon storms?”
“What species adapt best to sandy, unstable soils near river floodplains?”
“Which plants can survive occasional frost in the upper plains?”
“Our area suffers from seasonal drought — what perennial flowering plants last longest?”
“Which plants have deep roots that reach water during dry seasons?”
“What species act as natural windbreaks for open agricultural land?”
“Which plants are used in Mithila art and could be grown in our village garden?”
“What species have significance in Bhojpuri festival traditions?”
“Which plants are central to Tharu cultural ceremonies?”
“Which plants are used in Ayurvedic digestive remedies we can grow locally?”
“What species are mentioned in Ramayana or Mahabharata and also grow easily here?”
“Which plants symbolize prosperity or protection in local customs?”
“We want a garden showcasing regional identity — which species are iconic to this plain?”
“Which plants are traditionally used for making dyes?”
“Which species are used for traditional livestock medicines?”
“What native flowers are commonly offered in Hindu temples?”
